' MethodTemplateName=VBMain;
'' Setting colors in grid on Part properties Private CSS_COLOR_BASE = ".{0} {{ background-color: {1} }}"
' START your ccs definition ' List properties to apply css to Private MyPropertyList As New List(Of String)(New String() {"state", "classification"})
' Define colors by propertyName and corresponing value Class MyCssRules Public Shared Function GetBackgroundColor(propertyName As String, propertyValue As String) As String Dim bgColor As String = String.Empty Select Case propertyName ' State coloring Case "state" Select Case propertyValue Case "Preliminary","In Review" bgColor = "#FFFFBB" 'light yellow Case "Released" bgColor = "#99CC33" 'light green Case "Superseded","Obsolete" bgColor = "#FFBBBB" 'light red End Select ' Classification/Type coloring Case "classification" Select Case propertyValue Case "Component" bgColor = "#AAD4FF" ' "#77CCFF" 'light blue Case "Assembly" bgColor = "#0099FF" ' "#668AFF" 'darker light blue Case "Software" bgColor = "#fcce6a" ' Light orange Case Else bgColor = "#FFBBBB" 'light red End Select End Select Return bgColor End Function End Class ' END your ccs definition
' Main method Function Main() As Item Dim i As Integer For i=0 To Me.getItemCount()-1
' Get the current item Dim thisItem As Item = Me.getItemByIndex(i)
' Determine and update css Dim cssList As List(Of String) = GetCss(thisItem) Dim cssResult As String = String.Empty For Each css As String In cssList cssResult &= css Next thisItem.setProperty("css",cssResult)
Next i Return Me End Function
' Gets css for an item Private Function GetCss(item As Item) As List(Of String) Dim cssList As New List(Of String) For Each propertyName As String in MyPropertyList Dim cssValue As String = MyCssRules.GetBackgroundColor(propertyName,item.getProperty(propertyName)) If Not String.IsNullOrEmpty(cssValue) Then Dim css As String = String.Format(CSS_COLOR_BASE,propertyName, cssValue) cssList.Add(css) End If Next Return cssList End Function
